channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Black History Month: A look back at 2016 in film and TV
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with filmmaker Ava DuVernay about the film and TV of a decade ago as part of a Black History Month series about the year 2016.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with filmmaker Ava DuVernay about the film and TV of a decade ago as part of a Black History Month series about the year 2016.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: With horse whinnies, there's more than meets the ear
item.description: A horse's whinny is an unusually distinctive mix of sounds including both high and low frequencies, a new study in Current Biology shows.
item.content:encoded: A horse's whinny is an unusually distinctive mix of sounds including both high and low frequencies, a new study in Current Biology shows.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: What to know about the Jalisco cartel and its late leader
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with organized crime expert Steven Dudley about "El Mencho" and what the death of the cartel leader means for the fight against drug trafficking in Mexico.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with organized crime expert Steven Dudley about "El Mencho" and what the death of the cartel leader means for the fight against drug trafficking in Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Volunteers help make up the difference after national parks service cuts
item.description: Great Smoky Mountains National Park is the busiest National park in the U.S., but with the park service cutting nearly a quarter of all positions last year, volunteers have made up the difference.
item.content:encoded: Great Smoky Mountains National Park is the busiest National park in the U.S., but with the park service cutting nearly a quarter of all positions last year, volunteers have made up the difference.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: Blizzard stops most travel in Northeast
item.description: Blizzard conditions kept people at home from Delaware to coastal New England, with many communities seeing record snowfall. Travel was banned and clean up will be a big project in many towns.
item.content:encoded: Blizzard conditions kept people at home from Delaware to coastal New England, with many communities seeing record snowfall. Travel was banned and clean up will be a big project in many towns.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Urban sketchers turn cityscapes into art
item.description: In cities around the world, groups of people get together to do on-location drawing in the place where they live. They say it helps them notice new things in their city.
item.content:encoded: In cities around the world, groups of people get together to do on-location drawing in the place where they live. They say it helps them notice new things in their city.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Trump says he ended the war in DR Congo, but the fighting is far from over
item.description: In eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, as government troops and militia allies battle Rwanda-backed M23 rebels for control of mineral-rich land, civilians pay the price in a brutal war.
item.content:encoded: In eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, as government troops and militia allies battle Rwanda-backed M23 rebels for control of mineral-rich land, civilians pay the price in a brutal war.
item.dc:creator: Emmet Livingstone

item.title: Oregon cave holds 12,000-year-old sewn materials
item.description: Oregon caves housed evidence of sewn materials from the end of the last Ice Age.
item.content:encoded: Oregon caves housed evidence of sewn materials from the end of the last Ice Age.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: Mexico's military regains control after violence over the killing of a cartel leader
item.description: Mexico braced for more violence following an eruption of clashes after the armed killed the leader of a powerful cartel
item.content:encoded: Mexico braced for more violence following an eruption of clashes after the armed killed the leader of a powerful cartel
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Trump's sanctions on Iran have dramatically effected its economy and led to protests
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent admitted that Washington helped spark recent protests in Iran by creating a U.S. dollar shortage, leading to runaway inflation.
item.content:encoded: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent admitted that Washington helped spark recent protests in Iran by creating a U.S. dollar shortage, leading to runaway inflation.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam
